member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.CorrelationId
member.summary: Used in message responses and feedback Specifies the tracing correlation Id for the request; the resource provider *must* log this so that end-to-end requests can be correlated across Azure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.MessageId
member.summary: [Required for two way requests] Used to correlate two-way communication. Format: A case-sensitive string ( up to 128 char long) of ASCII 7-bit alphanumeric chars + {'-', ':', '/', '\', '.', '+', '%', '_', '#', '*', '?', '!', '(', ')', ',', '=', '@', ';', '$', '''}. Non-alphanumeric characters are from URN RFC.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.To
member.summary: [Required] Destination of the message

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.EnqueuedTime
member.summary: Time when the Message was received by the server

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.DeliveryCount
member.summary: Number of times the message has been previously delivered

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.ExpiryTimeUtc
member.summary: [Optional] The time when this message is considered expired

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.UserId
member.summary: [Required in feedback messages] Used to specify the origin of messages generated by IOT hub. Possible value: “{hub name}/”

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.Operation
member.summary: [Optional] Used to specify the role of the message in the communication pattern. Possible values: “d2c”: event message (device to cloud) “c2d”: message “d2creq”: inquiry request “d2cres”: inquiry response “c2dreq”: command request “c2dres”: command response

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.Ack
member.summary: [Optional] Used to specify the feedback required for the consumption of the message by the device. Possible values: “none”: no feedback “positive”: receive a feedback message if the message was consumed “negative”: receive a feedback message if the message expired without being completed by the device “full”: both positive and negative

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.MessageLockToken
member.summary: The lock token of the retrieved message

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.MessageLockTimeout
member.summary: Amount of time in seconds to lock message before abandoning the lock and allowing the message to be retrieved again

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.SequenceNumber
member.summary: iothub-sequencenumber A monotonically increasing identifier for each message

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.TrackingId
member.summary: iothub-servicetrackingid A tracking id to help trace errors on the service

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.HttpAppPropertyPrefix
member.summary: Prefix for all Application property Http Headers

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.HttpIotHubName
member.summary: Internal HTTP custom headers

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientIpAddress
member.summary: x-ms-client-ip-address Set to the client IP address used in the request; this is required since the resource provider will not have access to the client IP.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.PrincipalName
member.summary: x-ms-client-principal-name Set to the principal ID / UPN of the client JWT making the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientTenantId
member.summary: x-ms-client-tenant-id Set to the tenant ID of the client JWT making the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientAudience
member.summary: x-ms-client-audience Set to the tenant ID of the client JWT making the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientIssuer
member.summary: x-ms-client-issuer Set to the issuer of the client JWT making the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientObjectId
member.summary: x-ms-client-object-id Set to the object Id of the client JWT making the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientAppId
member.summary: x-ms-client-app-id Set to the app Id of the client JWT making the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientRequestId
member.summary: x-ms-client-request-id Caller-specified request ID, in the form of a GUID with no decoration such as curly braces (e.g. client-request-id: 9C4D50EE-2D56-4CD3-8152-34347DC9F2B0). A caller-defined value that identifies the given request. If specified, this will be included in response information as a way to map the request. If the caller provides this header – the resource provider *must* log this with their traces to facilitate tracing a single request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.ReturnClientRequestId
member.summary: x-ms-return-client-request-id Optional True or false and indicates if a client-request-id should be provided.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.ActivityId
member.summary: x-ms-activity-id The value that is used to pass activityID in REST API between services

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.ApiVersion
member.summary: api-version Specifies the version of the protocol used to make this request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.MicrosoftAsyncOperationHeaderName
member.summary: Azure-AsyncOperation Set to the URL where the result of the long running operation can be checked; to optionally be used in addition to the Location header.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.CustomHeaderConstants.RequestId
member.summary: x-ms-request-id A unique identifier for the current operation, service generated. All the resource providers *must* return this value in the response headers to facilitate debugging.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.DeliveryAcknowledgement
member.summary: Specifies the different acknowledgement levels for message delivery.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.DeliveryAcknowledgement.None
member.summary: Acknowledgement is NOT sent on delivery or failure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.DeliveryAcknowledgement.NegativeOnly
member.summary: Acknowledgement is sent only if delivery fails.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.DeliveryAcknowledgement.PositiveOnly
member.summary: Acknowledgement is sent only on delivery succeeds.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.DeliveryAcknowledgement.Full
member.summary: An acknowledgement is sent on delivery success or failure.

member.summary: Constructor which uses the argument stream as the body stream.

member.summary: Constructor which uses the input byte array as the body

member.summary: This constructor is only used on the Gateway http path so that we can clean up the stream.

member.summary: Dispose the current event data instance

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.Message.GetBodyStream
member.summary: Return the body stream of the current event data instance
member.exception: throws if the method has been called.
throws if the event data has already been disposed.
member.remarks: This method can only be called once and afterwards method will throw .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client.Message.GetBytes
member.summary: This methods return the body stream as a byte array
member.exception: throws if the method has been called.
throws if the event data has already been disposed.
